page.title: 03SMEATHARPE AERODROME NOW
page.content: Obviously, Smeatharpe was chosen as the site for an aerodrome because of its altitude and rural setting. For these same reasons in 1985, a great deal of military and civil aircraft pass over the village by day and night. The Blackdown Model Aircraft Club uses the aerodrome to fly their remote- controlled planes. Recently, motor- ised hang-gliders have joined the aerial traffic around Smeatharpe. There is a stock-car and banger racing stadium on the aerodrome, which has hundreds of spectators on Sundays. The buildings on the aerodrome are in various states of repair, some derelict, some used for storing farm machinery etc. The runways are still there, although a small part has recently been taken up. The area between is now grazing or arable land.
